place_description: Coffee, tea, baked goods & desserts in a quirky, brick-walled space with outdoor tables.

reviews_data.review_text: Very cute spot! And nice employees. Sad to say the coffee was weak and watery :( Add 1.25x more coffee to your drip!! Also the medium is more of a dark. Please offer light roast!!

I have patronized Smelly Cat for years. I stopped for a while after the incident with them supposedly destroying the work of local artists, but since returned as there was no clear cut story behind that (and certainly no apology.) Since then, I have experience odd and discomforting interactions a specific staff member has with a specific type of person. I am not going to irresponsibly go spewing wild accusations, BUT I left the review solely based on my disappointment in the apparent lack of morality. The coffee is great! However, not good enough for me to overlook malice behavior. I appreciate the response.
Shop is really cute, and staff are quick and attentive. There's not much space but they put a lot of thought into the lay out. Breakfast sandwiches are yummy!

Coffee is great! Burrito was okay but this is definitely a worth of trying. Place is nice and cozy. But the best part is knowing the name is coming from Friends the show. Exactly what I expected! Definitely coming back for more.
The best dirty chai latte in town, and whoever decided to play Disney music on a Monday morning is a true purveyor of joy! Thank you
Fun locale!
Super nice guys , and coffee always great thanks
The dirty chai frappe is quite literally the BEST coffee drink I have ever had. We've come back multiple times just for that. Love this place!

Good coffee - latte has three shots. Cute place. Order on an iPad (which felt a little robotic) but turned out to be really handy to customize my latte and they were busy, but quick! Staff at the pick-up window were very friendly.

Staff is very friendly, portions are very small do not go here if you are hungry, and the food is very expensive. Half and half is advertised as heavy cream. I ordered an iced London fog with almond milk and received a black tea with ice cubes. Zero sweetener or milk. No lavender, or vanilla foam just a black tea. Dirty chai and coffee was very good. Definitely a coffee place, but just that a coffee place.
formerly my favorite coffee spot in charlotte, but replacing the service with kiosks really took away the local charm. Ditch the kiosks please!
SLOWEST coffee shop I have ever been to. Coffee was fine - nothing special - but took 20 minutes to get a black cold brew.

Good coffee and nice location. However, As much as we try to support local businesses in the area, this place keeps turning us down.
Orders take too long and they are right only half the time. Plus, ordering online is tough when you try to customize. Also, they are obviously short staffed.

Really good coffee, but I recommend going in person. When ordering online they get my order wrong 75% of the time, which has started to get on my nerves a little, especially considering how expensive everything is.

Very confusing in person for first timers-- order at the kiosk outside and then you have to ask someone if you want to go inside. I see many people get confused at this trying to enter the locked door.

The inside is nice and cozy, but I wouldn't suggest it as a place to work as the tables are small and at the wrong heights for laptops.
First timer. Iced coffee was fantastic. I got a sausage biscuit that hit the spot. Would def go back.
Absolutely love getting to walk down here with my dog to enjoy a delicious cup of coffee! I love their dirty chai or their lavender lattes and of course, my dog loves their pup cups!

Homemade syrups and bagels are delicious! Signage communicated clearly the wait time and that breakfast stopped being served at noon. Kiosk ordering was easy & updated promptly when ingredients ran out.
Spiced Brown Sugar Iced Latte

10:30 on a Wednesday morning and it took 40 minutes to get an incorrect order that we had to hound the window for twice. If you have all the time in the world and boundless patience, the food isn't bad and it's a nice little outdoor spot - but at the end of the day it's still just bacon, scrambled eggs and shredded cheese in a tortilla for $10. It shouldn't take almost an hour and there's plenty of other places that fit the bill with reasonable coffee.

A charming coffee spot in central Noda, perfect for enjoying a cup while exploring the streets. Friendly staff ready to assist, whether you choose to sit inside or out. They boast quality coffee beans sourced from South America, ensuring a rich and flavorful brew. A must-visit for coffee lovers in the area!
Their speciality seasonal breads(like zucchini and Banana) are a must try.

Where do I start? We had a hard time parking because the lot was chained off from one direction. They don't let you go inside until after you order, and it was cold out. It took forever to order because their iPad wasn't working and the payment didn't work. Finally we got in and then they messed up whether our order was for here or to go. But the latte and the bagel were both very tasty.

I don't live in Charlotte but this place used to be great 8-10 years ago, when we visited 3 years ago they were charging full price for a refill which they didn't do previously and said it was because of covid but would go back to discounted refills post covid well here we are 4 years later and they still charge full price for refills. Oh well , I'll go to Central or Roots in the future if I return to Charlotte
Pleasant, nice, comfortable, food, taste good, homey, for this Homie.  Los Angeles, Dr. Dre out!
Seriously the best coffee in Charlotte! Great food! We love the staff too!!!
If you're looking for an authentic coffee house with the most amazing house made products look no further. This shop has it all, In house roasts, house made syrups, and handmade mugs.
1st visit. Great dirty chai. Delicious breakfast sandwich.

Great coffee shop in the middle of Noda. Full breakfast menu, some good sandwiches. Excellent biscuits. Coffee is top notch as well. Excellent service and there's some good seating inside as well as outside on their patio or around some local trees.
Smelly Cat has been a staple of Charlotte for quite some time. In all that time, it's never disappointed me! Thanks for staying true, y'all.
Been getting cappuccinos for 3+ years here. Never disappoints. Zucchini bread is also great

I might sound mean, but I felt insulted when they list this spot as the top coffee place in Charlotte lol. coffee is very hmmmm. okay I think starbucks did a better job on cappuccino at least. no offense. very cute logo, kinda hip interior,  and internet presence thou
Very very good coffee!!

The Smelly Cat has woven itself into the fabric of the NoDa community, embracing a people-centric ethos that sets it apart from the sterile franchises that dot the coffee landscape. The Smelly Cat exudes character, inviting patrons into a warm, cozy interior adorned with local art and bathed in the aroma of freshly roasted beans. Every day my Smelly Cat experience is truly extraordinary Chilling on the porch during the summer, cooled by gentle fans, or chatting in the shaded seating area surrounded by blooming flowers - the attention to detail in creating a comfortable and aesthetically pleasing environment is evident. And yes, there's even parking, a rarity in this bustling neighborhood.
Now, let's talk about the in-house baked goods - a symphony of flavors that dances on your palate. Crafted with love and attention, these treats complement the coffee offerings perfectly. The Irish coffee, a signature drink, is an embodiment of indulgence, with crunchy sugar crystals atop cold foam, creating a delightful contrast to the richness of the roasted beans. But what truly elevates Smelly Cat is its family-owned and operated ethos. This isn't just a coffee shop; it's a community hub where you're not a customer but a cherished member of the Smelly Cat family. The staff, with their genuine warmth, welcome you by name, creating an atmosphere that feels like a home away from home. The owner's presence is felt in every corner, ensuring that every order is not just fulfilled but crafted with love and precision.
The Smelly Cat Coffeehouse & Roastery isn't just a coffee shop; it's an experience, a celebration of community, culture, and the simple joy found in a cup of expertly crafted coffee. If you're in Charlotte, seeking more than just a caffeine fix, Smelly Cat is the destination where the aroma of authenticity and the spirit of NoDa blend seamlessly.

Smelly Cat Coffeehouse & Roastery is a celestial coffee haven in the heart of NoDa that deserves more than just five stars--it deserves a constellation. The aroma of freshly roasted beans welcomes you to a quirky, brick-walled space that's not just a coffee shop but my personal escape into caffeinated bliss.
The neighborhood charm is undeniable, with local art adorning the walls, creating an artsy and warm ambiance. The name "Smelly Cat" itself is a nod to the place's commitment to standing out, inspired by the iconic song from "Friends."
As a coffee enthusiast, Smelly Cat is my playground. Since 2012, they've been roasting their specialty coffee, and each sip is a journey through Charlotte's rich coffee culture. From single-origin pour-overs to nitrogen-infused cold brews, the menu is a testament to their dedication to quality.
The details at Smelly Cat are what make it extraordinary. Picture yourself on the porch in the summer, cooled by gentle fans, or finding solace in a shaded seating area surrounded by blooming flowers - every nook and cranny is designed for comfort. And, a coffee shop with parking in NoDa? That's a rare gem.
The in-house baked goods are a culinary masterpiece, perfectly complementing the coffee offerings. But what truly sets Smelly Cat apart is the family-owned and operated atmosphere. The staff greets you by name, and the owner's presence is felt, creating a warm and inviting space.
The Smelly Cat Coffeehouse & Roastery isn't just a coffee shop; it's a celestial experience. If you're in Charlotte and crave more than just a caffeine fix, Smelly Cat is the place to "Smell the Cat" - an olfactory journey through the finest coffee in the city. It's not just five stars; it's a constellation of stellar coffee and community.

Outside counter area is a great idea though a little chaotic. It was rather busy when we arrived late morning on Sunday, so I couldn't imagine it during typical busy hours. Seems like a hopping little place with regulars who know what to do, where to go, and what the typically order. Definitely a place to stop and try if you're in the area.
No sugar free options

We have traveled to several coffee shops throughout trips and this is definitely in our top 3! Going home with 2 bags of coffee to remember this incredible place! Owner was so kind and will definitely recommend.

The wait time is insane. If you're going to try this place out, please order online. I ordered 2 caramel lattes with oat milk, and only 1 with an extra shot of espresso. Both drinks were wrong and they didn't tell me which one had the extra shot. Both cups were labeled the exact same way. There was a woman asking questions about a job position. The lady at the pickup window advised her about availability and then got really snobby and said "I can't answer your question. I have to go make drinks" and slammed the window on her. If she had that attitude while making coffee, there wouldn't be a long wait time. It was not busy. Everyone who was already waiting before me looked extremely bothered by the wait time. Do not recommend.

9/69 breakfast sandwich of the week.

Breakfast bagel with avocado, cheese and egg.

Honestly I came in looking and feeling like a smelly cat and sustenance was needed. Overall quite nice! Sometimes with a bagel you need more filling to balance out what Webster dictionary can only describe as dearthy ness of the bagel. This one, however was soft and hard at the same time. Perhaps an expert deployment of butter??

Barely needed hot sauce on this one which is always a great sign. Would recommend and under a solid price point of 8 dollars.

Giving it 8.8/10 mcmuffs

This is such a cool spot! I love the indoor and outdoor seating which makes it pretty dog friendly, plus the parking spots right in front. Everyone was very friendly and the coffee and food was really great. I had a quiche and an iced latte with the spiced brown sugar syrup and it came out quickly. If I'm going through Charlotte again, I'm making a stop here again for sure.
I ordered a Chai Tea Latte with Brown Sugar. It took a long time to get it, when I did receive it, it was cold. Yes, I ordered it hot. I wasn't impressed and will not return.
The coffee at Smelly Cat is smooth, strong, and tasty housemade syrups. This has been my favorite coffee shop for years.

The coffee drinks we enjoyed (me latte, my husband coffee) were quite tasty however my latte was warm at best, which was extra discouraging due to the fact that we waited almost 15mins for it (my husband had finished his coffee by the time I got my latte).

Smelly Cat Coffee House is my go to spot since I have been back home. My food is excellent, my coffee is Hot and delicious and the atmosphere is sooo calm and cool. Before Covid it was  crowded and hectic. But now you can enjoy the space inside. 
Thank you Owner and Staff for making this   a welcoming space.
I love Smelly Cat! It's my favorite coffee place in Charlotte and offers a yummy, quick breakfast in their cute location in Noda! Highly recommend!

Things I've never seen at any other coffee shop:

1. No prices listed for their coffee or food
2. They don't accept cash
3. You have to order at a window on the side of the building and get rushed out if you mistakenly go through the front door
4. You need to ask to sit inside, as if it's a speakeasy not a coffee shop
5. They assign seating for you
6. It's a rather confusing set up for new customers that makes people uncomfortable and unwanted

Overall the coffee was fine, expensive to say the least but you wouldn't know until you're ready to ring up because there are no prices listed. I'd describe this coffee shop as progressive, pretentious, and unwelcoming.
Lovely space.  Sweet chai
great workers and good prices.
Super cute spot for fresh-brewed coffee plus friendly staff! --my daughter called them the "queens of shakes"!
Great coffee, great food, great people! Can't wait to come back here when visiting Noda again!

Your experience may vary, but on my last visit, after being seated inside I was asked to get up and move to make room for another party. That happened after they forgot to bring my food to the table. And afterwards they didn't deliver the promised refund for the food that never came, and I had to contact them again. That is enough for me to not want to come back.

There are half a dozen other coffee shops in walking distance and lots more a short drive away, all with the same or better quality coffee and that have never displayed such low standard of service or respect.
El chai, es otro nivel Aqui.

While Smelly Cat has been a delightful locally owned neighborhood stable for many years, I've come to especially appreciate some of convenience features added since Covid. The walk-up window is fabulous: when I'm in a hurry, I can order online via the Odeko app, and simply grab and go from the pick up window. Even better, I can easily grab my coffee from the walk up window when I'm walking my dog in the neighborhood, since there's no need to go inside. Sometimes, my pup even gets offered a puppacino! Oh, one more thing: a latte at Smelly Cat automatically comes with a double shot. Score!

Smelly Cat stands out as a distinct coffee shop in the artsy Noda neighborhood of Charlotte. While the space is cozy with limited indoor seating, they offer convenient walk-up window service and ample outdoor seating. On my visit, I tried their chai tea latte and it was delightful.
So yummy! Must try their new pumpkin bread with cream cheese frosting, it's to die for!!

Located in the heart of NODA, Smelly Cat checks all the boxes. They source and roast their own coffee beans and have a drink and food menu that is sure to please everyone.  Table seating is either inside, on the deck or under the trees.  The owner and staff are friendly and knowledgeable.  If you bring your canine friends be sure to ask for a pup cup.
It was very busy when we went (Saturday morning), but the staff was still super nice and attentive. Coffee's great and good breakfast!

This is one of my favorite baristas at my favorite coffee shop!!! The coffee is delicious, the breakfast burritos are my favorite food item on the weekends, and the staff & owner, Kathy are so kind.  I look forward to coming there for a treat on the weekends  Highly recommend Smelly Cat
Outstanding service great coffee & breakfast

Smelly cat used to be good when they roasted their beans on site, but now they've replaced it with an alcohol bar (even though this place is never open past 2pm?) and the quality has dipped significantly. Had a breakfast burrito that was clearly old and the eggs were hard. The blueberry muffin was stale too.
Been searching for a cute cafe with outdoor seating in Charlotte. Delicious breakfast burritos and they know the right proportions for a cappuccino!
Love this place. Great vibes, the prices aren't bad. Always a good cup of coffee.

Used to like it here. I waited 25 minutes for an iced matcha simply because I ordered a burrito with it too. My partner had their iced coffee right away. Kind of bizarre to have customers wait for their drink until food is ready. Never seen this done before at any cafe/customer.

i had the absolute WORST experience here. strayed away from my usual, kind coffee shop because i was given a gift card here for my birthday. when i tried to use said gift card they completely disregarded me and went to the other people paying in card, making me wait 20 minutes. when i went inside to see the problem the owner started raising her voice at me telling me there was no money on it and then refused to give me back the gift card. she then had the nerve to tell me i stole it!? what! after that terribly rude accusation, i called the person who bought me the gift card on speaker phone and then the owner proceeded to tell her that she was refunded for the gift card... my friend was never refunded... fishy. so, never buy a gift card here the owner will steal your money and then publicly embarrass you with lies. sounds like theft to me. unprofessional. mean. disrespectful. I am beyond disappointed and upset. their coffee isn't even that good so i will never waste my time or money here again & neither should you.
Good place for quick coffee and food but beware of the pre-made biscuits and burritos.  You will be sitting on the toilet for the next hour after eating.
I love this place.. I always meet Phoebe Buffay here for coffee on Sunday mornings..
They're so progressive, they don't take cash. I will never come here.
Sometimes great.  Sometimes overly-hot reheated stuff leftover from a prior day.

Huge disappointment, new to town and gave them a chance because the name is awesome and had great reviews. Firstly, nothing about the Vietnamese coffee is Vietnamese style. The cheap to go cup lids don't fit the cup so you'll spill half the coffee around your car, then they got the food order wrong. Failed basic standards.

Exceptional coffee crafted by skilled baristas in a relaxed atmosphere. My latte had a perfect balance of flavors. My only suggestion is to add more variety in alternative milk options for dietary restrictions. Despite that, I enjoyed the overall experience and will definitely be back for the excellent coffee.
I love the employees and the coffee!!
Amazing Coffee, Amazing Staff, Amazing Flowers. A must if you are in the area.
When you want something different than chain places this spot is great! Hope to be back soon.
Delicious coffee and great staff! Very cool vibes as well!
Love their frappe and coffee. The interior design is so pretty too.

Attempts to be special. NODA is a kitschy place sometimes hits, sometimes misses and occasionally in-betweens.  Smelly cat is an in-between.  Service at the window is slow. A server/helper brought you into the building to order. Funky design inside alcoves and seating area very eclectic. Reclaimed doors and odds and ends.  Ceiling covered in bags from coffee beans. Design is five star. Customer service and experience is definite 3 star.  They just miss in making you feel welcome. The drinks are odd mixes. The wake up is a weird mix of flavors. Not my thing. The London Fog was a creamy iced coffee good with great flavor.

Maybe deserved a second chance.

Will try again cuz I really wanted to like it just didn't.
Great no carb breakfast! Love the theme. Great baristas!
Great atmosphere; great coffee and food

We're just visiting Charlotte for the weekend and found this place & are so glad we did! The owner was more than accommodating- she explained the menu and even suggested samples before we ordered to make sure we got coffee that we really enjoyed! She went above and beyond to make sure our experience was excellent. They make all of their syrups and even roast their own coffee! The inside has a few tables and does have AC, she does lock the front door though always so just order at the window first and she will give you a table inside if you'd like, or there are lots of spaces outside to sit too! I had the lavender cold brew and it was delicious. My friend who came with got a decaf latte with spiced brown sugar syrup (which was homemade) & that was fantastic too! They also have some Cuban coffee that I would love to give a try too! We didn't order food, but would've gotten a bagel, frittata (only served on weekends), donut, or sandwich. Highly recommend this cozy, welcoming coffee shop!
Not bad, not amazing. Decent basic coffee
Really nice place also serve alcohol! Very home like.

Stopped here on my way through town. The service was really friendly. I got a lox bagel and a chai latte as I'm not a coffee drinker.  Both were very tasty.. the bagel took a minute you have to wait by the pick up window before taking a seat, but it was worth it. The bagel was toasted perfectly and the lox was cool and fresh. Perfect way to start the morning.

The atmosphere was nice. When I showed up, a few people had brought their dogs, others were just catching up. It was a nice peaceful spot that felt very local. It was the sort of spot you wished you lived next to so you could walk there for a nice moment with coffee/tea in the sun. There is also a shaded patio in the back where dogs aren't allowed, if that's your thing.

There is a parking lot and plenty of space when I went. People didn't seem to stay too long but long enough for a cup of coffee. People were a mix of individuals and groups, some working some chatting, some just enjoying the weather
Great coffee, cute shop, and yummy breakfast sandwiches.

My daughter and I enjoyed our handcrafted coffee beverages. I enjoyed a hot mocha, and she went for the caramel Frappuccino. It was a lovely day in the porch. We saw many people working while enjoying the weather on the patio. Looking forward to returning.

First time visiting this part of Charlotte, and we went here because we thought the name was cute lol. But the coffee was phenomenal! The spiced brown sugar latte was delicious and my friend loved their white chocolate latte. The environment is so cute and customer service was great as well. Would love to visit this little place again when back in Charlotte.

This is the opposite of a chain coffee shop!  We love this place.  The owner is actually hanging out making sure you are very satisfied.  They care about there products and their coffees taste special like there is a little love in all of it.  We worked here a couple of mornings and the wifi was solid.  Comfortable / quality products / friendly staff and an engaged owner that takes pride in her shop.
Possibly the second worse espresso I've been served.  It was barely warm and the beans were harsh.  Disappointing.

Loved the coffee and the atmosphere. Very welcoming to people from out of state too, so far we've been to some sketchy places but this place really beats every other coffee shop so far. The lattes are the BEST!
Super cozy and the coffee was so good
Terrible service. Order was delayed. Not coming back. It should not take 30 minutes to get a cup of black coffee.
Nice quiet place to have coffee with a friend and chat.

This spot had probably one of the best if not the best espresso shots I've had in my life. I came back a second day to make sure it wasn't a fluke - it wasnt. Their drip was on point too. I ended up picking up some beans to brew at home and have been loving those so far as well. I'll probably make it a point to visit this shop every time I go to Charlotte now.

This new set up isn't disability friendly unfortunately. There are 2 windows on side of the building for order & pickup. Everything is outside, we aren't allowed inside like for a bathroom. The deck at order window is tilted out into the street. I asked for accommodations at the flat pick up window. I was told No & told to move a chair to the order window. If I have balance challenges & I have showed you my cane in which I need one hand to use only leaving me with 1 hand left how exactly am I supposed to drag your heavy chair uphill. I did not expect such an insensitive response

Don't order tea here if you like black tea, better bang-for-buck sausage breakfast burrito can be found down the street at Rhino Deli Market (imo mcdonalds might even have better bfast burritos...), but apparently the coffee is pretty good

Little nice place but very disappointed to have most finished my quiche and my husband already had finishe his biscuit sandwich before they bring our coffees. When I complained the girl told me that usually they bring the food before the coffee.

This place is super popular but honestly the way it's set up is odd to me. Also one of the doors is just locked unless an employee lets you in but the one next to the parking lot (not the sidewalk) is unlocked? It's just odd. Also, why should you have to order outside if you're going to go sit inside? However if you want to sit outside it also works well with the order and pickup windows preventing too much congestion in one area. Food items are overpriced but the drinks are standard pricing and tasty so not much of a complaint there.
In Simple words, whenever I get a chance I drive like 10 miles to get their coffee. One reason is because of their coffee but the other big reason is the restaurant itself. So ambient.

I had high hopes for this place. I just couldn't understand it. We had reservations to eat inside. We had no idea where to go. The doors were locked. We saw a woman carrying a tablet who took another table of people inside, so we thought we just had to wait for her to come back out to seat us. She never did. We went up to a window to ask what we needed to do. That guy told us to go up to the other window, skip the line, and tell them we had a reservation. I did that. The person at that window said we needed to wait in line, order our food, and then we'd be let inside. What was the point of having a reservation if we had to be in the same line as everyone else? When we finally got inside, my friend received her food and coffee, and I didn't receive mine. My friend sat there not eating until an employee walked by and asked why she wasn't enjoying her food. That was the only reason I ever even got my food. The breakfast burrito was tiny, but the coffee was good. We walked down the street and got Reigning Doughnuts immediately afterward because we were still hungry. All in all, it was a disappointing stop. Love the coffee mural on the side of the building though!

I have been a customer for years, I buy their beans and have been getting breakfast and coffee at least 2x a week for years. The product is good but customer service and the odeko online ordering was a little less than successful today. I placed an order 25 minutes ago and am still waiting.  Can't talk to anyone as the windows closed and no updates. I understand there are staffing shortages but please update the app accordingly and provide realistic expectations. I waited way too long and got the wrong items. They still have the best coffee in town

The Smelly Cat Coffee House was highly rated, so my crew and I went out of our way to visit. I ordered an espresso in a ceramic cup and two pour overs to go. After 20 or so minutes and the other folks getting their drink (at various times), I inquired on my drinks. The espresso was sitting in a paper cup waiting to come out with the pour overs that were still not done. When I reminded them that the espresso was supposed be in a ceramic cup, the took the old espresso and dumped it in a ceramic cup. It was cold and no good- a waste of money. The pour overs were just okay. I was super bummed. It did not live up to the hype.
One of the best coffeehouses in Charlotte. Always get friendly service. Love their breakfast biscuits!
Yummy food, tasty drinks, cool atmosphere...LOVE IT!!!
Great little coffee shop
Got their frappe with vanilla. So good!! Liked it better than the Starbucks bottled frappuccinos. Will be returning for

This place looked amazing online but was a little underwhelming, sadly. The place is still beautiful, and the employees are incredibly kind. The parking is non-existent, the setup is inconvenient, which if the coffee was amazing I would completely look over. I drink black coffee and dark roasts are my go to, but I think there was something not right with this coffee. There was something about it that was bitter/almost burnt, that left a bad aftertaste after each sip. The breakfast options are a great idea, I do wish there were options for adding something spicy, different sauces, etc. As far as I could tell there weren't any listed on the board.
Helpful staff, friendly faces and dogs, pets welcomed and scrumptious mocha frappe!
Great coffee, friendly staff. This place always makes my day a bit better

$6.25 for that. This was the most pitiful thing I had ever seen and don't know how a company could actually serve this. We actually had to make more food after spending $30 on two of these and two coffees. Just ridiculous, do better.

Stopped for a quick coffee on my way out of town. I much prefer local business over chains and the evil Bucks. Found this spot on Google and figured I'd give it a shot. Meh. Disappointing considering the reviews I'd read. Got a coffee and a breakfast burrito and found both decidedly average at best. It may have its perks but the coffee wasn't one in my opinion.

This place is my favorite coffee shop in Charlotte. I'm always impressed with the quality of the drinks and the swiftness of the staff. A very friendly staff as well. Unfortunately today 9/1/22 there was a middle aged woman taking orders and her presence seemed to bog down their whole operation. Every person who ordered was handed shots of coffee to try, which was a nice sentiment, but certainly increased wait times. I love coming to this place, but one disruptive element certainly threw off the shops flow today.
Nice location, friendly staff and good espresso! Definitely helped with a hangover

Finally got a chance to try Smelly Cat and it did not disappoint!! I got the Ethiopian cold brew which was fantastic. My parents got herbal teas. I didn't get to try any of the food as we had just come back from Amelie's so I can't speak to that.

Service was very friendly, helpful with suggestions, and patient with decisions even though they were busy.

They had ample outdoor seating which was really nice but I couldn't tell what was going on with the indoor seating. The door to the inside looked to be locked and there was a sign saying that anyone who wanted in could get assistance from the barista. Maybe still a covid thing? Anyway, can't speak to the inside aesthetic either but I will definitely be back for more Ethiopian cold brew!

Got an oat milk latte with spiced brown sugar, delicious. Just strong enough and sweet enough. I also got a few of the roasted beans, so far I've only tried the Ethiopian Yirgachefe (I may or may not have spelled that correctly). This one has been great
omg! i got an iced dirty chai and it was so good! i never write reviews but it was just so great i had to write one! a bit pricy but worth it imo

They were hesitant to let us (4 adults & 2 babies on a very hot day) inside due to limited seating. We all bought coffee and pastries. No baby changing setup in bathrooms. All in all, cramped hipster coffee joint if that's your thing. Not family friendly. Excited to try their coffee in other spots that are more open & welcoming.
I absolutely love Smelly Cat. The coffee is always always a hit for me

Waited at the window for ten minutes to order due to "an iPad issue." Then ordered two drinks at the first window and went over to the second to pick them up. They had only made us one, so we asked for the second. The server stared at us blankly like he had stopped functioning, literally saying nothing. After awkward silence, we asked again and were told we'd have to get back in line--which was 16 people long at this point due to the "iPad issue"--and order again. No thanks.

To make sure we hadn't paid for the second drink, I asked for a receipt. He said he could only text or email it, so I gave my phone number. Realizing that he was only pretending to take down the number, probably assuming I'd be walking away, I told him I'd wait at the window until it came through. Then, he got a pen and asked for the number again. What respectable service. 

The one drink was good, so I'll give them a second star for that, but the service is clearly lacking.
Great place to meet friends in NODA
Such a fun spot to hangout and grab a bite or some coffee. This is the best coffee house around!

The coffee was excellent. They roast the coffee and I had a cold brew, which totally hit the spot. We had an egg, sausage & chees on a biscuit as well as a protein bowl. We both thought the food was really good. Well worth the visit
Best cup of cappuccino I've had in Charlotte so far! Friendly service as well.
The breakfast bowls are excellent. The folks behind the counter are always welcoming and lovely. Excited to have this as my neighborhood coffee shop

I am giving this place one star because zero is not an option. The girl taking orders told party they didn't do iced coffee, we had to get cold brew which was terribly bitter. But moments later someone behind us ordered iced coffee. I ordered a breakfast burrito
It was cold, under cooked and I didn't get the hot sauce I asked for with it. They served two people in line behind us before I had to go up and ask where mine was and why other people who ordered after me were being served. Terrible place, terrible service, terrible coffee.

Coffee is decent, staff is not pleasant.
Not family friendly... Twenty something's only I guess.
The coffee was very good. I had the Ethiopian (both hot and cold brew)! I had the bacon, egg cheese on a toasted plain bagel. It was very good, aa well. The atmosphere was great! Positive vibes.

I was in town for a couple of days and wanted coffee before starting our adventure for the day.  We got 2 breakfast items and 2 coffees.  (25$ btw) Got the coffees right away and it was BAD.  It was very bitter and we didn't even get half way through before throwing them away. They made us step aside for the food so that they can serve the customers behind us in line.  Well we waited... and waited... and there was no indication our food was done other than the fact that people that stood behind us in line were getting their complete order and no one ever said anything to us.  We went back to barista at the window that had our food sitting behind her the entire time!! Halfway back to the car we realized we were missing half of the order so we had to walk all the way back (parking was full so we were 2 blocks away.) luckily the quiche was actually pretty tasty so they mildly redeemed themselves.  Over all, not a great experience.  This is a place where if you judge it by it's cover it should be good but in reality the looks surpass the quality.  Go to Amelie's instead.

My wife and I visited just after 12 noon on Sunday. They were quite busy with constant in person orders and pick up orders. They were pretty quick to fill orders. The shop has a great atmosphere both inside and out. Plenty of people hanging out in the patio areas, which were on the front, side and in the back under a big tree. My wife had a chai tea which was ok but didn't have the kick she was expecting for a chai. I had a mocha frappe which was good but the roasted coffee flavor was very strong making it unbalanced. I had hoped they had some sugar free offerings in their syrups, but the only thing they had were some sugar free teas. We also had a piece of zucchini bread which was pretty good. Overall I'd give it a 3.5.

They have a 5 star rating for a reason, this roaster/restaurant is top notch. Between the excellent service and amazing coffee, this is a place to go to. I was privileged enough to meet the owner who is extremely kind and knowledgeable about her products. If you're looking for a cute spot to work or grab a quick bite to eat, this is your spot.
Mainstay in Noda and perfect place to hangout in the morning. Service is very slow though, they should expedite pouring someone a simple coffee instead of waiting for all the food orders ahead.
I come here every morning for coffee and breakfast! Very tasty and good customizablity!
Sweet cool little place love the sitting place under the tree in the summer and the coffee is just plain amazing.
Really good chai latte. Staff is fabulous. Nice patio to sit outside.
Coffee is great. Spot is cute. Food is fine. Salty eggs.

Omg there caramel frappe is to die for best frozen coffee drink I've ever had I won't be going to Starbucks anymore thanks to the wonderful young lady ahead of me who paid for my order since I couldn't get my card to work you're the bomb thanks smelly cat

Stopped going here after being harased by the staff.
Harasment goes both ways.  I went here every day for a long time untill the wait staff made me very uncomfortable.  Havent been back since.

Second time here over my weekend trip to Charlotte. If you are in/around/near NODA you have to at least get a coffee. Almost everything on the menu is made in house, from the coffee roasting to the baked goods. Everything I had was delicious and the staff was inviting and welcoming. They even asked how our latte was when we went to order seconds. Also if you are visiting with a dog there is a side window to order and plenty of outdoor seating. Thank you so much for the amazing food and vibe! Definitely a highlight of our stay in Charlotte.
It was great. Extremely friendly staff. Cute cats. Coffee was good.
So happy they are finally open. Great place to work before yoga!

Wonderful, welcoming and cozy atmosphere. Do not come in if you're in a rush ... This is not Starbucks. It's designed to be an experience. Take a break and truly savor. They have the best blueberry muffin I've ever eaten. The sausage egg and cheese burrito was excellent. My husband enjoyed the Vietnamese iced coffee with a splash of caramel. I swoon for the dirty chai latte. Width stopping by if you're in the area. Will definitely be back!
It's a OK spot to pick up a  cup
Kathy and her son have a great neighborhood coffee shop with plenty of accessories!

Can I say it??? Ima say it.... This coffee is the best coffee I have had sooooooo good and strong. This is my second time coming and I can finally leave a review. I had to wait until the second visit because the first was just too good to be true! I couldn't even get a good picture of my Spiced Brown sugar oat milk latte. I blinked and it was gone
Great service!!! Also the coffee was amazing. I had an iced brown sugar latte that was delicious. The sausage, egg, and cheese burrito was the perfect breakfast. I will be back!!
I asked for a strong not bitter coffee. I received a very bitter coffee. I was not impressed.

I am visiting Charlotte and I walk to Smelly Cat every morning to get coffee when I am walking my dogs. After the first day, Caleb and the other people working there called me by name when I walked up to the window. Amazing, friendly service and great coffee.
Smelly Cat Coffee House & Roastery was very good place. Coffee was awesome and service also fine.

First time here. Just Passing through. Wish inside was open! Dreary morning standing outside. But it's ok.  Ordered the Black cat coffee in a pour over. It's good! Definitely will go back next time in the area to try other things! Almost thought there might be smelly cats running around  #smellycatcafe
Best coffee I've ever had.
The  Drip coffee and Quiche are worth living for. The staff are always amazing and it's the best vibes of local coffee.
Cute spot in NoDa! Great coffee and relatively quick service. Nice outdoor spaces and great for people watching in the area!
Favorite spot to get a chai tea latte and puppychino for my dog.
It was wonderful great service and flavorful food I must say
Chill vibe and awesome coffee
Great coffee
Delicious food and drink, plus Natalie is dope af.
Such a chill & eclectic little place  with friendly service, good food/coffee, and beautiful scenery all around.  I don't get to come here often, but when I do it sure is a treat.

Had a great time at Smelly Cat this morning! Sunday morning, so it was really crowded and had a long wait but it was well worth it. The lemon herb cream cheese was to die for and my fiance got the bacon cheese biscuit and it was very good. Worth the trip!!!

One of the best coffee shops in Charlotte. Italian sizes and coffee with extra mess. Once the inside is open is also a great spot to sit and relax. They also have a limited alcoholic menu that varies from Beer to cocktails.
I'd recommend the coffee, not the food. My biscuit had obvious mold on the top.
Staff is very friendly but tea lacked flavor and the sandwiches were bland.

I've been to many, many coffee shops and Smelly Cat is honestly one of my favorites. They consistently have the best coffee around. They make the best iced dirty chai I've bought.They're breakfast burritos are also always a solid choice. A few of my other favorites from here include the vanilla latte and their iced Americano.

The employees are always friendly. They've got a nice chill atmosphere, both indoor seating (when it's allowed) and outdoor seating. I love that they're locally owned and roast their beans. This was a regular place to visit when I lived in Charlotte and I still make sure to stop in anytime I'm near Noda.
Super cute place.  Excellent little menu & coffee.  Get the biscuit

Friendly people, solid coffee and a relaxing atmosphere. My one complaint is that, in the last month, three or four of my orders have been messed up. I'm not sure if it's the masks or busy line, but the cashier keeps taking down the wrong size or leaving items off. I would suggest double checking everything before it's finalized.
Beautiful and cozy coffee shop!

Cute and modest- great coffee and ambiance. With COVID there is now a to-go window on the patio which is also adorable and spacious with lots of flowers 

Grab a pack of stickers or some swag if you're visiting from out of town
Amazing coffee and vibes! I knew I had to try it out when I was in the Charlotte area.
Loved my bagel and tea!
Yummy coffee and great vibes!  I like sitting at the table by the sunflowers

They do not accept cash or allow customers in to the store. I understand that they took restrictions for covid but now those restrictions need to be lifted and the business should return to normal. I will not be back until cash is accepted and customers are allowed inside. It is a shame, I was once quite fond of this establishment. Employees are very friendly.

Coffee was absolutely amazing, vibes were incredible, staff was super sweet and friendly. Now, if you need somewhere to absolutely CLEAN your stomach out, go to this place. I don't know what MAGIC, is in their beverages but my gut is clean, clear and my body is EMPTIED.....of all toxins after I drank this beverage. 12/10 recommend, absolutely amazing for the gut health.
This was a very cute little walkup spot. Very friendly ladies working the order & pickup windows. Wrote a really cute note on my breakfast bag. Made me smile! Glad I went there.
Traveling into town for my first time and couldn't resist this place by name only. 4 minutes from my Airbnb and great staff, atmosphere and neighborhood!! Highly recommended :)
Awesome service. Great coffee
Great local shop with quality food and drinks.

We totally had to visit smelly cat based off local reviews and appreciated the friendly service! Really convenient location in a fun corner of Charlotte. Loved the cool eclectic decor and seating outside for some fresh air! Thankful for some actually really good decaf!
The fact that they even have a cortadito on the menu is worthy of a 5 star, but the coffee itself was really smooth and flavorful.
Best walk up breakfast place, we came back twice on our trip to NoDa. Plenty of first come seating around the building also

Love this place! Been here a few times and now it's my go to coffee spot. Asked for recommendations and the staff was super friendly and knowledgeable, made me feel welcome. They're environmentally friendly and don't give straws (except metal/silicone ones you can purchase for $2) and the patio is dog friendly. I always ask for a pupiccino and put a cookie in it. Outdoor seating is enough to appease the crowds and the wait time is minimal, not to mention there's free wifi. I recommend looking at their specialty menu, the alcoholic drinks are awesome! Didn't even taste too strong like other drinks I've tried. The parking is usually ok but keep in mind they close kinda early and will close off the parking lot by 5pm. Overall great spot for some affordable tasty coffee.
Friendly, fast, delicious, Great!

Absolutely my number 1 cafe in charlotte.

Super friendly staff and very good coffee with some food options. Love the vibes!
Great Chai Latte
I love this place, super yummy and great eclectic atmosphere!

You have an exterior service window. I was outside, six away from the server. Why would I need a mask in order for you to serve me?

Please stop discriminating against people with medical conditions!
Delicious coffee and food, all in a fun location. Have a walk up window which makes things easy during this crazy COVID time. 2 thumbs up!
Great Coffee! Great Service

Coffee and Breakfast sandwich I got here were both really good!
I personally enjoy a lighter roasted coffee than they offered so I would suggest they start to brew two pots, one light and one normal. You can sort of customize your breakfast sandwich, so that's cool If ur into that sorta thing. The decor of the place is nice, but I cannot comment about the vibes cuz we were all sitting out in the covid cold waiting for our food.
Hope to be back here in a world less controlled by local jurisdiction.
Great coffee, cool location! Dog friendly!

Awesome little place! They have togo windows which made it very easy to order and get your things. Accommodating with today's times, of course the coffee is really good which is important but a combination of their really really nice service was awesome to me imo. Maybe it was just the two girls working today because I don't come here often but they were super friendly and nice and my latte was good af so 5 stars from me lol.

Great experience.  They really have their covid procedures dialed in.  one window for ordering and one window for pickup and plenty of outdoor space to hang out while waiting.  I'm a big fan of their noda nights espresso beans.  I buy the big bag in whole bean format to put in my super automatic Jura espresso machine.  The americanos and cappuccinos turn out fantastic.  The espresso bean flavor profile pairs nicely with oat milk.  But hey what coffee doesn't

Love the play on the TV show Friends. They have many coffee options as well as choices with liquor in them, great cure for any hangover! There is a cute seating area outside as well and it was a great place to relax for a little bit. Staff was friendly.
Staff was very nice and friendly, caramel frappe was amazing!

Smelly Cat is consistent in a positive way!
They are always nice, their coffee is on point, and mmmmm, those breakfast burritos!!! Always my #1 coffee spot in Noda!
Had no idea what a sledgehammer was. It's 2 oz of liquid. More like a ballpeen hammer if you ask me. Still yummy.
Legit.

Great coffee, friendly staff, LOVELY outdoor seating areas in a cute part of town. Post-Demic this is highly recommend.

During COVID, you should be aware they do not enforce their "masks required" policy. Here's a man who waited in line, ordered, and was served, with no mask.
always thought the coffee was gross, and i have not been back since they showed their true colors and tore down and destroyed someone else's property, i have not been back.
Best dirty chai in Charlotte! A must stop for any coffee lover visiting the area. Well worth any wait!

I will start by saying I love this place. I live about 25 minutes away and every so often I'll take the trip to get their chai frappe, dirty. Today was a little different.

I really don't have time to go through all the details but they got my order wrong, and then blamed me for it, and was unwilling to do anything about it. What it really boils down to is the reality that they didn't like the fact that I wasn't wearing a mask. It didn't matter that we were outdoors, and socially distanced, "I was having a hard time understanding you because you weren't wearing a mask" is what I was told by the manager.....okay definitely my last visit.

Maybe it's a Saturday morning thing, but every time I'm here they mess up orders and take extremely long to make simple drinks. I love their coffee & build your own breakfast sandwich but it took them 15 mins to get my coffee out and I've had to re-tell them my order before because they somehow lost it? Definitely disappointing.

So, if you are lactose intolerant just like me. You can't place orders online for food with no cheese because their system doesn't allow to do it unless you order through the window. Very disappointed, by the way they won't refund if you already ordered food and added the comments NO CHEESE... "Because it's the system"

Fire. Period. I had the best dirty chai I've ever had in my life (and I've had a lot of them) at this joint. Beautiful Sunday afternoon, outdoor seating, tunes were on point. If I could recreate the moment every single day I'd be the better for it. Never change Smelly Cat!

I'm a big fan of local places that aren't chains. My wife and I have been going here for years and it's a great place. Great coffee and when they open the inside back up they have Wi-Fi and board games. With covid 19, they have chairs outside and you can still access their Wi-Fi. Definitely check it out if you haven't had a chance to yet.

By the way, you can also by bags of their coffee beans. We get the Noda Nights for our espresso machine and they grind it their for us.
Pretty good coffee, good people.

Best coffee stop in NoDa!! The staff is so friendly and helpful!! The girl who took care of us was super enthusiastic about coffee and happy to help us find what we'd like best based on our taste! And it was absolutely delicious of course :)
Great coffee! Friendly service.
Love this place...

Extremely friendly and helpfully staff always!! Great name and always fresh coffee available. I would of given 5 stars but I'm not from around here and was only here for a few days and didn't want to download a special app to pre-order our breakfast so I called to place order and I guess with all the fancy technology they can't take orders over the phone. They are also cashless so be prepared

Long waits,  out of many items, errors with 50 percent of the orders, and NO cash. Coffee was $6 tried to pay with a ten was told "I can't take cash, I don't have a drawer." Told him to keep the rest then he said well we aren't taking cash at all . No where on their site is this listed. What do you expect though from try hard hipsters? I will take my CASH elsewhere.
Dank coffee

This place is great.
Cold brew was great, pastries & desserts are tasty as well.
THEY DESERVE THE 5  STARS.
Never visiting again
The no carb breakfast bowl is awesome.
Great place to sit outside and chill.
Open for business with a touch of social diatance for safety.
Good
Best coffee I've ever had. I drive from Tennessee sometimes just to have there coffee. You can never go wrong with smelly cat
My happy place. I drive from 45 minutes away every Sunday just for their cold brew.
Really good coffee drinks and desserts.

Small and unique. Had a good pour over and enjoywdlled sitting out front. They are lacking much indoor seating but the neighborhood is nice and fun, so sitting outside is enjoyable.
They offer some food, plenty of coffee options, and some alcohol. Great, fun, local coffee shop experience.
The world needs more places like this
Great coffee. Great atmosphere.
Great coffee, cool atmosphere
Owner is awful.  Plenty of other coffee places in town. Don't give this woman any more money.
Owner is a vicious thief.
Such a unique place with plenty of seating indoor and outside! Great service and fair prices! The barista even asked if I needed samples before I bought anything!

Always a favorite of mine when in NODA. Throughout the week their open from 6:30 am until 3 p.m. and the weekends until about 10p.m. I knew the owner form years ago at the Statesville location. Until he moved into the building in NODA. It was so nice to find out that they kept it open after Richard passed a few years ago. I would suggest anything they have to offer. From pastries to coffee and beer and some wines, you can't beat their price. My over all favorite is their sledgehammer. A shot of their house made espresso with a little chocolate.  It give just the right sweetness but with the true taste of the coffee bean. Not to mention, the smelly cat is names as you've guessed it, from Phoebe from Friends and her song " smelly cat" it's definitely an on the list of things to see in NODA.
Love this place!

Cool little place that practices sustainable recycling.  Dishes, cups, paper and aluminum foil are left in individual containers by the door.  This is a huge plus for me.  Very friendly staff that while super busy, still kept the atmosphere light and genuinely enjoyed interacting with their customers.  Oh yeah, the black coffee that I ordered tasted wonderful.
Good food, people, place-the decor & music was awesome.  Visitor from Chiefs Kingdom-COME HERE
Great little spot for coffee and/or Irish coffee

Saw a lot or reviews for this "cute little coffee shop"--- emphasis on little, from the limited seating and parking lot to the one person gender neutral bathrooms. Had a fine experience but don't expect a plethora of seating during peak hours

Fast service, friendly employees, and the caramel latte was so good! The space is very small but there is outdoor seating which worked out fine. Parking is a bit of a hassle to find be there is a public parking deck a block away.

While visiting from NY, I was very impressed by this place. A friends theme coffee shop with a modern interior to keep you interested. From "private sitting areas" that are divided by doors, to the unique paintings & decorations made it an amazing adventure to hang out with someone & talk whilst drinking some very good coffee.

Would highly return 10/10

P.S. Shoutout to whomever thought it was a good idea to write the name of the restaurant on the sidewalk cement.
Ordered a frozen coffee then learned there are no straws. We saved a straw but may kill two people and baby when I crash while trying to sip a frozen drink out of a cup while driving.
This place has become one of my favorite coffee shops! My favorite drink is the Sweet New Orleans cold brew coffee. Friendly staff and cool atmosphere!
Charlotte staple coffee Cafe and roaster. A must have in Noda area.
Their hot coco and vanilla lattes are delicious. They also came out and brought us a puppachino. Really nice staff.

Are the prices higher than your average coffee shop? Yes! BUT, you certainly get what you pay for here. My iced dirty chai was perfectly sweet, and my breakfast bowl was filled with fluffy scrambled eggs, fresh arugula and tomatoes, and a (surprisingly!) generous serving of ripe avocado.

While this would not be an every day coffee run for me due to the price point, this will certainly be my new go-to for when I feel like treating myself- and I would happily recommend it to anyone!
As inviting and cozy as it was years ago when it was on Union Street in concord
Cozy and eclectic!
Great coffee from great people.  Grab one and stroll the neighborhood!
Love! Chill vibe, great background music, and nice atmosphere with plenty of seats to get your work done or sit and chat. Coffee and service were great too
Great little place.  Coffee was good

Yes we all get it.  This is one of if the the best small Coffee shop in the entire Charlotte area.  Just don't get too much of a big ego about it okay?  When you walk in here the interior design is immaculate.  The lighting is perfect.  The staff is quirky, confident and professional.  They also have a great seating area in front and under a patio.  Expect to see someone doing some really hip activity like writing a poem in a journal or making beaded jewelry when you go here.  It is a definite place that has been a great contributor to the hipness of NODA.
Did not actually visit but the atmosphere appeared to be oh so lovely!

Small yet inviting! I love spaces that have a bar you for you to sit and work at!!

They have a wonderful variety of cold brews and different coffee drinks. The outdoor seating is perfect for grabbing coffee and quick breakfast with a friend.

I'll definitely be coming back!

Cute local coffee house in the NoDa area of Charlotte. We only tried coffee but I found out that they do sandwiches and pastries too but a small bar for alcohol beverages too.
The frappe was delicious and served quickly.
Delicious coffee but the place inside is very crowded, not super comfortable chairs either.. outside is better when the weather is mild.

Small and cozy.  Seating inside and outside.  Coffee drinks made to perfection.  Some alcohol served. Have breakfast or lunch and never be disappointed with the food.  Perfect place to dine with friends or to spend a couple of hours working.  Most important:  staff is slways friendly.  You are greeted with enthusiasm every time.

I have been an avid customer buying their roasted beans every 2 to 4 weeks for the past two years. I went in this morning and purchased another bag of their beans and was reading with my six-year-old across the street for one hour after purchasing the beans. I came back to see that they had called the towing company who had put a wheel-lock on my car and made me pay for it.

In terms of actual coffee service, it all depends on the barista so it's very inconsistent. And for the most part they don't do latte art.

Best coffee shop in town. Love the owners, everyone that works there. They are family and treat everyone as family. Freshly roasted beans - Central American Fusion is our favorite. We've been coming here every morning we are in town since we moved to NoDa in 2013. This is what a local coffeeshop is all about.
